SAM.raw_line: Haven't you had any sleep, Mr Frodo?Not before Mr Frodo's had something to eat.Here.I'm not hungry - leastways, not for lembas bread.Alright. We don't have that much left.The journey home., . You treacherous little toad!I heard it from his own mouth he means to murder us!You miserable little maggot! I'll stove your head in!Call me a liar! You're a liar!I don't care! I can't do it, Mr Frodo. I won' t wait around for him to kill us !You don't see it, do you? He's a villain!I'm on your side, Mr Frodo.No, Mr Frodo!No!Mr Frodo!What are you up to? Sneaking off, are we?Alright, alright - you just startled me is all. What were you doing?Fine, have it your own way.It's always dark here -He took it! He must have!You're a lying wretch! What did you do with it?That's a filthy lie!I'll kill him! I'll kill him!Alight, I'm sorry, I didn't mean for it to go so far, I was so angry . . . Here, let's rest up a bit.No, no, you're not alright! You're exhausted! It's that Gollum; it's this place; it's that thing around your neck. I could help a bit . . . I could carry it for a while - share the load.I don't want to keep it . . . I just want to help!Shut up, you! Go away. Get out of here.But . . . he's a liar . . . he's poisoned you against me.You don't mean that.

GANDALF.raw_line: Hobbits!And there Saruman must remain, under your guard, Treebeard.No. He has no power any more.Peregrin Took! I'll take that, my lad!No word ... nothing.Do we know that?That Frodo is alive. Yes - yes, he is alive.Fool of a Took!Minas Tirith??? Is that what you saw?And what did you tell him? Speak!What did you tell him about Frodo and the Ring?There was no lie in Pippin's eyes; a fool, but an honest fool he remains. He told Sauron nothing of Frodo and the Ring.No!They will be. You must come to Minas Tirith by another ra ... od Follow the river, look to the black ships. Understand this . . . things are now in motion that cannot be undone.Of all the inquisitive Hobbits, Peregrin, Took, you are the worst. Hurry, hurry!Three days ride as the Nazgul flies and you'd better hope we don't have one of those on our tail.Run Shadowfax, show us the meaning of haste.We have just passed into the realm of Condor!Minas Tirith . . . City of the Kings.Yes, the white tree of Gondor. The tree of the King.Hail, Denethor, Son of Ecthelion, Lord and Steward of Gondor.Pippin!Get up! My Lord, there will be a time to grieve for Boromir, but it is not now. War is coming ... the Enemy is on your doorstep. As Steward, you are charged with the defence of this city. Where are Condor's armies?Authority is not given to you to deny the return of the King - Steward!Come.You're in the service of the Steward now - you're going to have to do as you're told, Peregrin Took . . . Guard of the Citadel!It's the deep breath before the plunge.There never was much hope.This will be the end of Gondor as we know it. Here the hammerstroke will fall hardest.The Witchking of Angmar . . . , . You've met him before . . .We come to it at last ... the great battle of our time.The board is set, the pieces are moving.Peregrin Took, my lad, there is a task to be done. Another opportunity for one of the Shire-folk to prove their great worth!Amon Din ... come on . . .Hope is kindled.Foreseen and done nothing!Where? When?. . . And then the Pass of Cirith Ungol.Faramir . . . Tell me everything.Faramir! Your father's will has turned to madness! Do not throw away your life so rashly!Your father loves you, Faramir! And will remember it before the end.
